ElementType.name: attribute
ElementType.description: The Attribute tag adds a property with the specified name and value to the component associated with the parent tag. It behaves the same as the JSF Attribute tag except that it creates a value binding for expressions instead of immediately evaluating it.

AttributeType.name: name
AttributeType.description: the name of the attribute

AttributeType.name: value
AttributeType.description: the value of the attribute

ElementType.name: validator
ElementType.description: The Validator tag adds a new validator instance to the component associated with the parent tag. The new validator instance is found by evaluating a binding expression, or looking up a validator ID. This implements the JSF 1.2 definition of <f:validator>.

AttributeType.name: validatorId
AttributeType.description: the ID of a validator instance registered in faces-config.xml

AttributeType.name: binding
AttributeType.description: the value binding expression to a property that returns a ValidatorInstance.

ElementType.name: forEach
ElementType.description:
The forEach tag is a replacement for the JSTL <c:forEach> tag that works with ADF Faces components. Today, <c:forEach> cannot be used with any JSF components or tags. This tag brings that functionality to JSF, but it is limited to ADF Faces tags. This tag also has several limitations not found in <c:forEach>:
  • <af:forEach> does not currently support scenarios where the size of the "items" list or array changes from one request to the next. It may be possible to work around this in specific scenarios by manually deleting all children of the parent component (<af:selectOneListbox> in the above example), but this has not yet been tested.
  • <af:forEach> does not support arbitrary java.util.Collections; it can only iterate over java.util.Lists or arrays.
  • <af:forEach> executes at the time the JSP tag executes. So it does not have access to any EL variables that are created by JSF components. For example, the <af:table> creates an EL variable using the value of the "var" attribute. However, this EL variable is not available to <af:forEach>

AttributeType.name: items
AttributeType.description: the items over which iteration takes place

AttributeType.name: var
AttributeType.description: the name of the variable to expose

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description: Name of the exported scoped variable for the status of the iteration.

AttributeType.name: begin
AttributeType.description: the beginning index

AttributeType.name: end
AttributeType.description: the ending index

AttributeType.name: step
AttributeType.description: the number of steps per iteration

ElementType.name: setActionListener
ElementType.description: The setActionListener tag provides a declarative syntax for assigning values before an action fires

AttributeType.name: to
AttributeType.description: the target for the value; must be an EL expression

AttributeType.name: from
AttributeType.description: the source of the value; can be an EL expression or a constant value

ElementType.name: returnActionListener
ElementType.description: The returnActionListener tag is a declarative way to allow an action source to return a value from a dialog or process.

AttributeType.name: value
AttributeType.description: The value to return as the dialog/process result. This can be an EL expression or a constant value.

ElementType.name: resetActionListener
ElementType.description: The resetActionListener tag provides a declarative syntax for resetting values before an action fires

ElementType.name: region
ElementType.description: The region tag adds components defined in a separate region file onto the current component tree. The separate region file is usually a jsp file. It is currently experimental and should not be used by developers.

AttributeType.name: regionType
AttributeType.description: Identifies which region to use. All the available regions must be declared in a region-metadata.xml file.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: This ID must be unique within this page.

AttributeType.name: value
AttributeType.description: A value to pass to the region definition.

AttributeType.name: rendered
AttributeType.description: Whether or not this region is rendered.

ElementType.name: regionDef
ElementType.description: The RegionDef tag is used to define a region. Its primary purpose is defining the "var" property of any usage of this region definition, which will be used to expose the attributes of the region into the region definition.

AttributeType.name: var
AttributeType.description: the var to set on the parent region component

ElementType.name: validateRegExp
ElementType.description: Validate expression using java regular expression syntax.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: pattern
AttributeType.description: pattern to be matched in the input value.

AttributeType.name: noMatchMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, when users input does not match the specified pattern.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} represents the 'pattern' expected in the input

ElementType.name: selectInputText
ElementType.description: The selectInputText is a text field that also supports launching a dialog to assist users in entering a value.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: searchDesc
AttributeType.description: the search description for the button that launches the dialog. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

AttributeType.name: icon
AttributeType.description: the URI for an alternative image on the button to launch the dialog

AttributeType.name: readOnly
AttributeType.description: whether the element is read-only.

AttributeType.name: disabled
AttributeType.description: whether the element is disabled.

AttributeType.name: shortDesc
AttributeType.description: the short description of the bean. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

AttributeType.name: partialTriggers
AttributeType.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too.

AttributeType.name: label
AttributeType.description: the label of the bean.

AttributeType.name: tip
AttributeType.description: the tip text associated with the control

AttributeType.name: simple
AttributeType.description: a boolean value that controls whether the component provides label and message support; when set to "true", the component will not display messaging support or the label (these attributes may be ignored: label, labelAndAccessKey, accessKey, messageDescUrl messageTargetFrame, showRequired, tip), and may use simpler layout primitives

AttributeType.name: onfocus
AttributeType.description: the event handler for when the element receives focus.

AttributeType.name: onblur
AttributeType.description: the event handler for when the element loses focus.

AttributeType.name: onchange
AttributeType.description: event handler for when the value is changed.

AttributeType.name: onclick
AttributeType.description: an onclick Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: ondblclick
AttributeType.description: an ondblclick Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onmousedown
AttributeType.description: an onmousedown Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onmouseup
AttributeType.description: an onmouseup Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onmouseover
AttributeType.description: an onmouseover Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onmousemove
AttributeType.description: an onmousemove Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onmouseout
AttributeType.description: an onmouseout Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onkeypress
AttributeType.description: an onkeypress Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onkeydown
AttributeType.description: an onkeydown Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: onkeyup
AttributeType.description: an onkeyup Javascript handler.

AttributeType.name: styleClass
AttributeType.description: the CSS style class of the bean.

AttributeType.name: inlineStyle
AttributeType.description: the inline CSS style for this element

AttributeType.name: showRequired
AttributeType.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

AttributeType.name: valign
AttributeType.description: the vertical alignment of the label and other contents. The acceptable values are "middle", "top", and "bottom".

AttributeType.name: messageDescUrl
AttributeType.description: an URL to a page with more information about the message.

AttributeType.name: messageTargetFrame
AttributeType.description: the target frame for the message description URL, if any.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

AttributeType.name: onselect
AttributeType.description: event handler for when text becomes selected.

AttributeType.name: columns
AttributeType.description: the number of columns to display in the text control. If no value is specified, a default of 30 columns is used. One column is approximately one character in the browser's current display font.

AttributeType.name: maximumLength
AttributeType.description: the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text control. Note that this value is independent of the "cols" displayed.

AttributeType.name: autoSubmit
AttributeType.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

AttributeType.name: windowWidth
AttributeType.description: width of the window, if this command is used to launch a window.

AttributeType.name: windowHeight
AttributeType.description: height of the window, if this command is used to launch a window.

AttributeType.name: action
AttributeType.description: a reference to an action method sent by the commandButton, or the static outcome of an action

AttributeType.name: actionListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an action listener

AttributeType.name: returnListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an return listener

AttributeType.name: immediate
AttributeType.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or in the Process Validators phase.

AttributeType.name: required
AttributeType.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

AttributeType.name: validator
AttributeType.description: a method reference to a validator method

AttributeType.name: valueChangeListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an value change listener

AttributeType.name: requiredMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
the message to be displayed, if 'required' validation fails.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component

AttributeType.description: the value of the component

AttributeType.name: converter
AttributeType.description: a converter object

AttributeType.name: rendered
AttributeType.description: whether the bean is rendered. When set to false, no output will be delivered for this bean.

AttributeType.name: binding
AttributeType.description: a binding reference to store the component instance

AttributeType.name: attributeChangeListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an attribute change listener

ElementType.name: panelPage
ElementType.description: PanelPage lays out an entire page.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: title
AttributeType.description: The title to display for this page.

AttributeType.name: messageType
AttributeType.description: whether page is a messaging dialog. Legal values are "error", "info", "confirmation", "warning", "processing" and "none".

AttributeType.name: chromeType
AttributeType.description: what the chromeType is for the page: compact or expanded. If compact, the brandingApp will be shown alongside the branding instead of below the branding.

AttributeType.name: quickLinksShown
AttributeType.description:
whether "quick links" will be shown for this page.

When "quickLinksShown" is set to true, the panelPage will automatically search for panelHeader's inside its contents. One quicklink will be added to each - minus the first header, and minus any headers inside other headers (a.k.a. "subheaders").

In addition, panelPage will automatically add a top-level header if the "title" attribute is set. This header is skipped over when looking for quicklinks.

This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

AttributeType.description: the short description of the bean. This text is commonly used by user agents to display tooltip help text.

AttributeType.description: the IDs of the components that should trigger a partial update. This component will listen on the trigger components. If one of the trigger components receives an event that will cause it to update in some way, this component will request to be updated too.

AttributeType.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

Please keep in mind that the letters used for upperAlpha and lowerAlpha are the 26 letters of the English language, which may lead to translation problems.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

The easiest, and most convenient way to specify both the text and the mnemonic together is to use textAndAccessKey.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

ElementType.name: convertNumber
ElementType.description: Converts an string to a Number and vice versa based on the 'pattern' or the 'type' set.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: currencyCode
AttributeType.description: The ISO 4217 currency code, applied only when formatting currencies. Currency code can also be set for the entire application in adf-faces-config.xml file. If currency code is not set on the converter, and if set on adf-faces-config.xml configuration file it will be used by calling AdfFacesContext().getCurrenctInstance().getCurrencyCode(). This currency code will be used during call to getAsString() for formatting, provided type is set to 'currency'.

AttributeType.name: convertCurrencyMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'currency' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

AttributeType.name: convertNumberMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'number' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

AttributeType.name: convertPatternMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage message, when value cannot be converted to a number, based on the pattern set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the specified conversion pattern

AttributeType.name: convertPercentMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of the FacesMessage, when value cannot be converted to a number, when type is set to 'percent' and pattern is null or not set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user

AttributeType.name: currencySymbol
AttributeType.description: Currency symbol, is applied only when formatting currencies. If currency code is set then symbol will be ignored.

AttributeType.name: groupingUsed
AttributeType.description: Flag specifying whether formatted output will contain grouping separators. Default value is true.

AttributeType.name: integerOnly
AttributeType.description: Flag specifying whether only the integer part of the value will be formatted and parsed. Default value is false.

AttributeType.name: locale
AttributeType.description: Locale whose predefined styles for numbers are used during formatting and parsing. If not specified, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

AttributeType.name: maxFractionDigits
AttributeType.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

AttributeType.name: maxIntegerDigits
AttributeType.description: Maximum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

AttributeType.name: minFractionDigits
AttributeType.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the fractional portion of the output.

AttributeType.name: minIntegerDigits
AttributeType.description: Minimum number of digits that will be formatted in the integer portion of the output.

AttributeType.name: pattern
AttributeType.description: Custom formatting pattern which determins how the number string should be formatted and parsed.

AttributeType.name: type
AttributeType.description: Specifies how the number string will be formatted and parsed. Valid values are "number", "currency", and "percent". Default value is "number".

ElementType.name: validateDateTimeRange
ElementType.description: Validate that the date entered is within a given range.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: maximum
AttributeType.description: the maximum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) is also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

AttributeType.name: minimum
AttributeType.description: The minimum java.util.Date. ISO 8601 date strings, of the form 'yyyy-MM-dd' (for example 2004-06-22) are also allowed. This will be parsed to date.

AttributeType.name: maximumMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value exceeds the maximum value set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the maximum allowed date

AttributeType.name: minimumMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, when input value is less than the set minimum value.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date

AttributeType.name: notInRangeMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
The detail error message to be used for constructing faces messages, if input value is not with in the range, when minimum and maximum is set.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the minimum allowed date
  • {3} the maximum allowed date

Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:

AttributeType.name: value
AttributeType.description: the data model being used by this component. The specific model class is oracle.adf.view.faces.model.CollectionModel. You may also use other model instances, e.g., java.util.List , array, and javax.faces.model.DataModel. This component will automatically convert the instance into a CollectionModel.

AttributeType.name: rows
AttributeType.description: the maximum number of rows to display in a single range of rows. Some ranges might have fewer than the number of rows specified by this attribute (eg: the last range might have an insufficient number of rows). To display all rows at once, set this attribute to 0.

AttributeType.name: first
AttributeType.description: the index of the first row in the currently range of rows. This index is zero-based. This attribute is used to control which range of rows to display to the user.

ElementType.description: Converts string into java.util.Date and vice versa based on the pattern and style set.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: convertDateMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for values that cannot be converted to date when the pattern / secondary pattern is set or when type is set to 'date' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

AttributeType.name: convertTimeMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'time', pattern is not set or is null

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

AttributeType.name: convertBothMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, for date-time based value that cannot be converted to date when type is set to 'both' and pattern is not set or is null.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} an example of the format the converter is expecting

AttributeType.name: dateStyle
AttributeType.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the date component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "date" or "both". Valid values are "shortish", "short", "default", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "shortish".

AttributeType.name: locale
AttributeType.description: Locale whose predefined styles for dates and times are used during formatting or parsing. If not specified or if null, the Locale returned by FacesContext.getViewRoot().getLocale() will be used.

AttributeType.name: pattern
AttributeType.description: Custom formatting pattern which determines how the date/time string should be formatted and parsed.

AttributeType.name: secondaryPattern
AttributeType.description: Second pattern, which will be used as a second attempt to parse a string if the primary pattern or styles fail, but is never used for formatting strings.

AttributeType.name: timeStyle
AttributeType.description: Predefined formatting style which determines how the time component of a date string is to be formatted and parsed. Applied only if type is "time" or "both". Valid values are "default", "short", "medium", "long", and "full". Default value is "short".

AttributeType.name: timeZone
AttributeType.description: Time zone in which to interpret any time information in the date string. If not set here, picks this value from adf-faces-config.xml configuration file. If not defined there, then it is defaulted to GMT.

AttributeType.name: type
AttributeType.description: Specifies what contents the string value will be formatted to include, or parsed. Valid values are "date", "time", and "both". Default value is "date".

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:

  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

ElementType.name: panelForm
ElementType.description: The panelForm lays out input form controls, such that their labels and fields line up vertically. It supports multiple columns, and also supports a footer facet.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: rows
AttributeType.description: the number of rows after which to start a new column. This attribute defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE. The number of rows actually rendered depends also on the columns attribute. If the children will not fit in the given number of rows and columns, the number of rows will increase to accomodate the children. This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: maxColumns
AttributeType.description:
the maximum number of columns to show. This attribute defaults to 3 and 2 on PDAs.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: width
AttributeType.description: the preferred total width of the layout. May be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels

AttributeType.name: labelWidth
AttributeType.description:
the preferred width of the label. Usually a percentage, but may be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels. If the width is not specified, it will default appropriately. If specified as a percentage the labelWidth plus the fieldWidth should add up to 100%, regardless of the number of columns. If the labelWidth is specified and is a percentage the fieldWidth will be derived appropriately if not specified.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: fieldWidth
AttributeType.description:
the preferred width of the field. Usually a percentage, but may be specified as either a percentage or an absolute number of pixels. If the width is not specified, it will default appropriately. If specified as a percentage the labelWidth plus the fieldWidth should add up to 100%, regardless of the number of columns. If the fieldWidth is specified and is a percentage the labelWidth will be derived appropriately if not specified.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

ElementType.name: commandLink
ElementType.description: The commandLink control creates a link representation of a UIXCommand.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: text
AttributeType.description: the textual label of the link.

AttributeType.name: disabled
AttributeType.description: whether the link should be considered disabled. This attribute only has meaning when links are used in certain container types, such as global headers and tab bars.

AttributeType.name: textAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this link. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this Link instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey.

AttributeType.name: onfocus
AttributeType.description:
the event handler for the link gaining the focus.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: onblur
AttributeType.description:
the event handler for the link losing the focus.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

ElementType.description: The Page component is similar to the PanelPage component, except that instead of having menu1, menu2, menu3, and menuGlobal facets for adding menu information, the user binds a model object and a stamp to render these areas.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: title
AttributeType.description: The title to display for this page.

AttributeType.name: messageType
AttributeType.description: whether page is a messaging dialog. Legal values are "error", "info", "confirmation", "warning", "processing" and "none".

AttributeType.name: chromeType
AttributeType.description: what the chromeType is for the page: compact or expanded. If compact, the productBranding will be shown alongside the corporate branding instead of below the corporate branding.

AttributeType.name: quickLinksShown
AttributeType.description:
whether "quick links" will be shown for this page.

When "quickLinksShown" is set to true, the panelPage will automatically search for panelHeader's inside its contents. One quicklink will be added to each - minus the first header, and minus any headers inside other headers (a.k.a. "subheaders").

In addition, panelPage will automatically add a top-level header if the "title" attribute is set. This header is skipped over when looking for quicklinks.

This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

AttributeType.name: selectedStep
AttributeType.description: the current step. The valid range is 1 to maxStep. It defaults to 1.

AttributeType.name: maxStep
AttributeType.description: the last possible step. If this value is not known, it should be set to MAX_VALUE_UNKNOWN (-1), which is also the default value. If maxStep is MAX_VALUE_UNKNOWN, then no text is rendered between the Back/Next buttons. When maxStep is 2 and selectedStep is 1, then only a Continue button is rendered.

AttributeType.name: text
AttributeType.description: the text description of items being navigated. The default is "Step".

AttributeType.name: previousActionListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an action listener that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the previous step.

AttributeType.name: nextActionListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to an action listener that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the next step.

AttributeType.name: nextAction
AttributeType.description: a reference to an action method that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the next step, or the static outcome of the action.

AttributeType.name: previousAction
AttributeType.description: a reference to an action method that will be called when the singleStep component navigates to the previous step, or the static outcome of the action.

AttributeType.description: the summary of this table's purpose and structure for user agents rendering to non-visual media.

AttributeType.name: banding
AttributeType.description:
the banding type to use on this table. Three values are allowed:
  • none: (the default) the table isn't banded
  • row: rows will be alternately banded
  • column: columns will be alternately banded

AttributeType.name: bandingInterval
AttributeType.description: the number of rows in each banding group. For example, if "bandingInterval" is set to "2", then two rows/columns will be light, followed by two that are dark, etc.

AttributeType.name: focusListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to a focus listener

AttributeType.name: rowsByDepth
AttributeType.description:
the maximum number of records that can be displayed at one time (range size). Each level of depth in the tree can have a different range size. The first number in the array sets the range size for the root collection. Each subsequent number sets the range size for the corresponding depth. The last number becomes the default for each subsequent level of depth.
If a node has more children than the range size, navigation rows will be rendered above and below the child nodes.

AttributeType.description: a method reference to a selection listener

AttributeType.name: disclosureAllListener
AttributeType.description: a method reference to a disclosureAll listener

  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

AttributeType.description: the set of expanded nodes for this component. Each entry in the set is a path of an expanded node.

AttributeType.name: focusRowKey
AttributeType.description: the rowKey of the currently focused row. The rowKeys of the ancestor rows of the focus row are added to the treeState pathSet by default.

AttributeType.description: whether the associated control displays a visual indication of required user input. If a "required" attribute is also present, both the "required" attribute and the "showRequired" attribute must be false for the visual indication not to be displayed.

AttributeType.name: valign
AttributeType.description: the vertical alignment of the label and other contents. The acceptable values are "middle", "top", and "bottom".

AttributeType.description: an URL to a page with more information about the message.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to the form element specified by the for, if set (or this component itself, if it is a "non-simple" form element). For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode. If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

AttributeType.name: labelAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "value" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "L&abel" will set the label to "Label" and the access key to 'a'.

AttributeType.name: autoSubmit
AttributeType.description: If set to TRUE on a form element, the component will automatically submit the enclosing form when an appropriate action takes place (a click, text change, etc.).

AttributeType.name: immediate
AttributeType.description: whether the value is converted and validated immediately in the Apply Request Values phase, or in the Process Validators phase.

AttributeType.name: required
AttributeType.description: whether a non-null, non-empty value must be entered. If false, validators will not be executed when the value is null or empty.

AttributeType.description: a method reference to a validator method

ElementType.description: The commandButton control creates a button representation of a UIXCommand.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: text
AttributeType.description: the textual label of the button.

AttributeType.name: disabled
AttributeType.description: whether the button should be disabled.

AttributeType.name: textAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this button. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this button instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey. The easiest, and most convenient way to specify both the text and the mnemonic together is to use textAndAccessKey.

AttributeType.name: partialSubmit
AttributeType.description: whether the action should be done through a partial page submit or not. Default is false: no partial page submit.

AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: truncateAt
AttributeType.description: the length at which the text should automatically begin truncating. When set to zero (the default), the string will never truncate. Values from one to thirteen will be treated as thirteen - the outputText component will not truncate strings shorter than thirteen characters.

AttributeType.name: description
AttributeType.description: an additional description to be attached to the text, for use in improving accessibility. The description will be available to screen readers and other accessibility agents, but will not be otherwise visible. This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: pda, phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: escape
AttributeType.description: an attribute controlling whether output will be escaped for the current markup language or not. This attribute defaults to true, and should only be set to false if absolutely necessary. When set to false, you may exposed to cross-site scripting attacks if the value of this component is any way derived from values supplied by a user; see outputFormatted for a safe alternative. In addition, nearly all attributes are ignored when "escape" is set to false (e.g., "styleClass" is not output).

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

AttributeType.description: The set of acceptable patterns, as a whitespace separated list. The first pattern in the list will be used for formatting java.awt.Color values. All patterns will be tried in order to convert Strings back into java.awt.Colors. If no patterns are set, the default is "#RRGGBB r,g,b".

AttributeType.name: transparentAllowed
AttributeType.description: Whether the converter should allow generation of a "transparent" color (a black color with an alpha of zero). The converter uses a String version of "transparent" that is translated for the user's locale.

AttributeType.name: convertMessageDetail
AttributeType.description:
Custom error message to be used, for creating detail part of faces message, when users input does not match the specified pattern.

Parameters:

  • {0} the label that identifies the component
  • {1} value entered by the user
  • {2} the pattern the converter is expecting

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this item. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple locations in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this item instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey.

AttributeType.description: the textual label of the go component. Go components will also render children elements (including text nodes), though not all subclasses of the go component will necessarily support children.

AttributeType.name: longDesc
AttributeType.description: a long description associated with this go component. This attribute is only used when the go component is in certain container types, such as the message box.

AttributeType.name: disabled
AttributeType.description: whether the go component should be considered disabled. This attribute only has meaning when go components are used in certain container types, such as global headers and tab bars.

AttributeType.name: textAndAccessKey
AttributeType.description:
An attribute that will simultaneously set both the "text" and "accessKey" attributes from a single value, using conventional ampersand ('&') notation.

For example, setting this attribute to "T&ext" will set the text to "Text" and the access key to 'e'.

AttributeType.name: accessKey
AttributeType.description:
Character used to gain quick access to this component. For accessibility reasons, this functionality is not supported in screen reader mode.

If the same access key appears in multiple input fields in the same page of output, the rendering user agent will cycle among the elements accessed by the similar keys. Note that user agents are inconsistent about dealing with two links having same access key, and so the cycling behavior is dependent on what the user agent provides.

This attribute is sometimes referred to as the "mnemonic".

The character specified by this attribute must exist in the Text attribute of this go component instance. If it does not, the user will receive no visual indication of the existence of the accessKey.

ElementType.name: column
ElementType.description: Component that is used as a child of the Table component. The Column component defines the header, footer and data for a single column in the Table.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: formatType
AttributeType.description: the type of formatting to use for this column. The legal values are "text", "number" and "icon", which describe columns that display text, numbers and buttons, respectively. Text columns are left-justified, number columns are right-justified, and button columns are center-justified.

AttributeType.name: gridVisible
AttributeType.description: whether or not to display a grid line before the column's content (to the left in a left-to-right locale).

AttributeType.name: width
AttributeType.description: the preferred width of this column, e.g., "30%", "100px".

AttributeType.name: headerText
AttributeType.description: text to display in the header of the column. This is a convenience that generates output equivalent to adding a "header" facet containing an outputText.

AttributeType.name: bandingShade
AttributeType.description: the background color to use for this column. The legal values are "light" and "dark".

AttributeType.name: noWrap
AttributeType.description: whether or not the column contents should be allowed to wrap

AttributeType.name: headerNoWrap
AttributeType.description: whether or not the column header should be allowed to wrap

AttributeType.name: sortable
AttributeType.description: whether or not the column is sortable. A sortable column has a clickable header that (when clicked) sorts the table by that column's property. Note that in order for a column to be sortable, this attribute must be set to "true" and the underlying model must support sorting by this column's property. This column's "sortProperty" attribute must be set if sorting is desired.

AttributeType.name: separateRows
AttributeType.description:
whether or not the children of this column should be rendered on separate rows. Setting this attribute to true will cause each child to render in its own row. Setting this to false will cause all the children to be rendered in one cell, which will rowSpan across the rows of the Columns whose children are rendered on separate rows.
This attribute is not supported on the following agent types: phone, voice.

AttributeType.name: rowHeader
AttributeType.description: Whether or not this column is a row header column.

AttributeType.name: var
AttributeType.description: Name of the EL variable used to reference each element of this collection. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value).

AttributeType.name: varStatus
AttributeType.description:
Name of the EL variable used to reference the varStatus information. Once this component has completed rendering, this variable is removed (or reverted back to its previous value). The VarStatus provides contextual information about the state of the component to EL expressions. For components that iterate, varStatus also provides loop counter information. Please see the this component's documentation for the specific properties on the varStatus. The common properties on varStatus include:
  • "model" - returns the CollectionModel for this component
  • "index" - returns the zero based row index

ElementType.name: objectMedia
ElementType.description: The objectMedia component displays media content, such as audio, video, or image in a player embedded in the user agent.

AttributeType.name: id
AttributeType.description: the identifier for the component

AttributeType.name: width
AttributeType.description:
width in pixels to reserve for the media player plus its content. As the extra width needed for the media player controls can vary from media player to media player and depend on the controls displayed in the media player, it is recommended that the "innerWidth" attribute be used in preference to this attribute.

If both the "width" and "innerWidth" attributes are specified, the "width" attribute will be used.

If no width is specified, the width of the media control is determined by calculating the "innerWidth" and adding any extra width necessary to display the media player controls.

AttributeType.name: height
AttributeType.description:
height in pixels to reserve for the media player plus its content. As the extra height needed for the media player controls can vary from media player to media player and depend on the controls displayed in the media player, it is recommended that the "innerHeight" attribute be used in preference to this attribute.

If both the "height" and "innerHeight" attributes are specified, the "height" attribute will be used.

If no height is specified, the height of the media control is determined by calculating the "innerHeight" and adding any extra height necessary to display the media player controls.

AttributeType.name: innerWidth
AttributeType.description:
width in pixels to reserve for the media player content. This will typically be set to the pixel width of the media resource to display.

If no "innerWidth" is specified, the "innerWidth" will be defaulted based on the content type of the media resource to play.

If both the "width" and "innerWidth" attributes are specified, the "width" attribute will be used.

AttributeType.name: innerHeight
AttributeType.description:
height in pixels to reserve for the media player content. This will typically be set to the pixel height of the media resource to display.

If no "innerHeight" is specified, the "innerHeight" will be defaulted based on the content type of the media resource to play.

If both the "height" and "innerHeight" attributes are specified, the "height" attribute will be used.

AttributeType.name: source
AttributeType.description: the URI specifying the location of the media resource. If no contentType is specified, the contentType will be inferred from the extension of the source attribute.

AttributeType.name: autostart
AttributeType.description: a boolean value that controls whether the media resource loads and plays automatically without user initiation. When set to "true", the media resource will load and play as soon as possible.

AttributeType.name: playCount
AttributeType.description: the number of times the media resource will play. If set to "0", the resource will loop until the user stops the playing.

AttributeType.name: contentType
AttributeType.description: the MIME type of the media content returned by the "source" URI. This attribute is used as a hint when determining which player to pick, how the controls of the player are to be configured, and the default size of the media player. If it isn't specified, an attempt will be made to derive this information from the extension of the source URI.

AttributeType.name: standbyText
AttributeType.description: Message to display in the media player while the media resource is loading.

AttributeType.name: player
AttributeType.description:
which media player to use to play the media resource. If possible, the media control will accomodate this request. However, if the requested player is not available on the user agent, or does not support playing the media resource, an alternate player will be used instead. In all cases, the "link" player is used as a fallback if no other player is available, or the requested player fails for some reason.
  • "none"

    use a link in the user agent page to launch the playing of the media resource.

    This player setting uses the least amount of space on the page and uses the user agent's built in content type mapping to determine how to display the media resource.

  • "quicktime"

    use the Apple QuickTime player.

  • "windows"

    use the Windows Media Player.

  • "real"

    use the Real Player.

AttributeType.name: controls
AttributeType.description:
the set of controls made available to the user for controlling the media playback. The actual set of controls displayed for the same value may differ between players. Likewise, the amount of space occupied by the controls will differ from media player to media player. This can cause problems if the size of the media control has been specified by the "width" and "height" attributes rather than "innerWidth" and "innerHeight".
  • "none"

    don't show any controls for the media player and don't allow control access through alternate means, such as context menus.

    This value is typically only used in kiosk-type applications where no user control over the playing of the media is allowed. It is typically used in conjunction with setting the "autostart" attribute to "true", and the "playCount" attribute to "0" to cause the media play immediately and then loop.

  • "noneVisible"

    don't show any controls for the media player but allow control access through alternate means, such as context menus.

    This value is typically only used in applications where user control over the playing of the media is allowed, but not encouraged. It is typically used in conjunction with setting the "autostart" attribute to "true", and the "playCount" attribute to "0" to cause the media to play immediately and then loop.

  • "minimal"

    show a minimal set of controls for playing media on the media player.

    This value gives users control over the most important media playing controls, while occupying the least amount of additional space on the user agent.

  • "typical"

    show the typical set of controls for playing media on the media player.

    This value, the default, gives users control over the most common media playing controls, without occupying an inordinate amount of extra space on the user agent.

  • "all"

    Show all available controls for playing media on the media player

    Using this setting can cause large amount of additional space to be required, depending on the media player used.

The default of this attribute is "typical".
